<[silence:3600]>

Kinematics <[silence:1200]> originates from the Greek κίνημα (kínēma), meaning "movement" <[silence:250]>—a fusion of κινέω (kinéō), "to move" <[silence:250]> and the suffix -ics <[silence:1200]> It is the branch of mechanics studying motion <[silence:250]>—position, velocity, acceleration—without considering forces <[silence:1200]>

Three related concepts are dynamics <[silence:250]> trajectory <[silence:250]> and degrees of freedom <[silence:3600]>
